How to use...

( STEP BY STEP:

1. INITIAL CONNECTION
Ensure your phone and PS3 are connected to the same Wi-Fi network.

2. CONFIGURE PS3
On the console, go to Network Settings > Internet Connection Settings > Custom.
Advance until you reach the "Proxy Server" option.
Select "Use" and enter the IP (Server) and Port shown on the main screen of this app.

3. START PROXY
On the phone, press the green "START" button. The status will change to ONLINE.

4. CHECK FOR UPDATE
On the PS3, go to System Update > Update via Internet.

5. INSTALL HFW
The console will detect an update (it may appear as version 9.00 or similar, but don't worry, it is actually the HFW 4.92 we are injecting). Proceed to download and install.

6. FINISH
Once the installation is complete or the PS3 restarts, you can press "STOP" in the app to turn off the server.)

HFW Proxy Installer...

( Full Technical Documentation of PS3 Proxy Server for Android (HFW Redirection Mode)

This documentation details the architecture, source code, and debugging process of the Android application project. The purpose is to intercept the official system update request and redirect it to a custom server hosting the modified firmware (HFW).

Credits and Sources of Inspiration:


Full functionality available on GitHub https://github.com/kizeo0/HFW-Proxy-Install


1. PSX-Place: PS3 Proxy Server for Android v2.2 (Universal) https://www.psx-place.com/resources/ps3-proxy-server-for-android-v2-2-universal.795/


2. GitHub: Edw590/PS3-Proxy-Server-for-Android https://github.com/Edw590/PS3-Proxy-Server-for-Android


Community and Troubleshooting: * The Other Side: Accessing PSN with a PS3 Proxy Server https://www.elotrolado.net/hilo_acceso-a-psn-con-ps3-proxy-server-en-firmware-4-82-ofw_2306364


Functional Reference: The Python script provided by the user (Kizeo) served as the exact model of behavior to replicate.


Architecture: The proxy server operates using a man-in-the-middle inspection model. When it detects the official file (ps3-updatelist.txt), it responds with an HTTP/1.1 302 Found code pointing to the HFW.)
